title: Barcelona keeping an eye on Chelsea trio? Transfer news and gossip from Friday's papers
text:
Barcelona keeping an eye on Chelsea trio? Transfer news and gossip from Friday's papers PLUS: Liverpool face competition for Athletic forward while Pep Guardiola wants a Middlesbrough wonderkid Share Nemanja Matic celebrates with Cesar Azpilicueta after scoring the second goal for Chelsea (Photo: Reuters / Russell Cheyne) Share Get football   Could   
Barcelona are keen on three Chelsea stars who rarely get the headlines. 
With a change of manager coming in the summer at the Nou Camp, the club are already making plans for their transfer business. 
And according to Marca, they are keeping an eye on Blues trio Cesar Azpilicueta, Marcos Alonso and Nemanja Matic. 
Barca officials travelled to London last week to watch the three of them, as well as Arsenal full-back Hector Bellerin. 
Here are the rest of the transfer stories from Friday's Mirror and other newspapers and websites... Thursday's gossip from other newspapers and websites Liverpool face stiff competition for Athletic Bilbao forward Inaki Williams (Photo: David Ramos) 
Liverpool face stiff competition for Athletic Bilbao forward Inaki Williams from Juventus and Borussia Dortmund if they are willing to meet his buy-out clause of €50 million in the summer. (AS) 
AC Milan want to make Gerard Deulofeu 's loan move permanent and CEO Adriano Galliani has already made contact wabout a move. (Calciomercato.com) 
West Ham continue to chase Saint-Etienne right-back Kevin Malcuit and reportedly made a bid of €10 million for the defender in the January, but will have to come back with more. (Le 10 Sport). 
Manchester United and Manchester City are ready to battle it out for the purchase of Roma defender Antonio Rudiger . (TalkSPORT) 
Manchester City face competition from Chelsea for £25m-rated Middlesbrough defender Ben Gibson to his summer shortlist. (The Sun) Thursday's stories from the Mirror Ronald Koeman has vowed to fight tooth and nail to keep star Ross Barkley (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Ronald Koeman has vowed to fight tooth and nail to keep star Ross Barkley . 
But, in a message that will have every Evertonian bracing for the worst, he also admitted there will be little the Goodison club can do if midfielder Barkley, who has been strongly linked with Tottenham, is determined to go in the summer. 
Joe Hart’s agent says that talks over his future are yet to be opened with Manchester City - but that he expects plenty of interest in the England stopper, currently on a season-long loan at Italian club Torino, this summer. 
Marco Verratti will not be leaving Paris Saint-Germain this summer, according to the French club. Chelsea and Barcelona have been closely linked to the Italian midfielder but PSG's sporting director Patrick Kluivert insists that he will not be moving. 
Arsene Wenger has revealed Arsenal made an approach for Monaco starlet Kylian Mbappe last year. The 18-year-old has shot to stardom with the Ligue 1 leaders, scoring 13 goals this term. Mbappe only made his debut last season but has already attracted interest from both Manchester clubs, as well as Arsenal. 
The Arsenal top brass want to believe under-fire manager Arsene Wenger can reinvent himself and build a new squad to bring back success. 
And he is showing a mood for change by tailoring training programmes for the run-in — a subtle but significant switch from the past. poll loading Should Arsene Wenger go at the end of the season? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
